title: 16-year-old in critical condition, 2 arrested after drug-related shooting in Walnut Hills
content:
CINCINNATI —
Two teenagers were arrested in connection with a Wednesday drug-related shooting that left a 16-year-old critically injured.
Dremar Barton and Gabrielle Cody, both 18, were arrested a few blocks from the shooting. Barton has been charged with felonious assault and aggravated burglary and Cody has been charged with complicity.
Officials said that the teenager was shot just before 5 p.m. in the 900 block of Yale Avenue during an altercation over a drug transaction.
Police said a fight started in the back seat of Cody's car during a marijuana transaction. As they struggled over the marijuana and a bookbag, Barton tried to shove the victim out of the backseat, then fired a gun.
A plain clothes officer spotted the car believed to be involved speeding away from the scene of the shooting and members of the Gang Enforcement Squad initiated a traffic stop on the 1500 block of Sherman Avenue, Cincinnati police said.
Barton, Cody and a 16-year-old male were inside. The 16-year-old was released to his mother.
The victim underwent surgery for a gunshot wound to the upper torso and was listed in critical but stable condition Thursday.
Anyone with information on the incident is asked to contact Crime Stoppers at 513-352-3040.
